Description: Lentoid flask with two vertical handles: the fabric of this monochrome flask is a translucent cream-white very closely imitating calcite. A cord of black and white diagonal twist encircles the rim. Assembled from several pieces with small areas missing.
Curator's comments: The provenance suggested is based on information supplied by the vendor. It is doubtful that the lentoid flask in glass was known at so early a date. A monochrome vessel, though not of lentoid shape, in the Louvre (E 11225) is of the same fabric as this vessel and gives a perfect imitation of calcite. Bibliography: E. A. Wallis Budge, 'The Mummy' (Cambridge 1925), 392; B. Nolte, ‘Die Glasgefässe in Alten Ägypten (Berlin 1968), 133.
